intro: Potamogeton × leptocephalus var. leptocephalus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pondweed, is a hybrid aquatic plant native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 2 mm wide, giving it a distinct appearance in freshwater environments. This plant thrives in shallow, slow-moving waters and often forms dense underwater stands. Its flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female flowers present on the same inflorescence. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
